numlitem.para: Associated turbine bypass valve is secured open (full heat),
Associated pack overheat protective system is operative,
PACK RST Switch is operative,
Lower lobe cargo A/C FLOW RATE is not selected for the associated pack's zone, and
Lower lobe cargo A/C FLOW RATE is not selected HIGH.

numlitem.para: A pack with an inoperative ACM will, under some flight conditions, have degraded temperature control. However, cabin pressurization will be operative.
When operations are conducted with a turbine bypass valve secured open:
Do not operate affected pack until airborne and TAT is +10°C or cooler. Select affected Pack Control Selector to NORM, or to A, or to B.
During descent when TAT rises above +10°C, select affected Pack Control Selector OFF.
Based on which pack is affected, the LOWER LOBE CARGO COND AIR FLOW RATE, if required, should be selected as follows:
Pack 1, select LOW FWD or LOW AFT. Conditioned air is unavailable to the Lower Lobe Cargo compartment not selected.
Pack 2, select LOW FWD. Aft Lower Lobe Cargo conditioned air is unavailable.
Pack 3, select LOW AFT. Fwd Lower Lobe Cargo conditioned air is unavailable.
Carriage of animals and perishables in associated cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the affected PACK selector "ACM INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To secure a turbine bypass valve open:
Open the P6 panel PACK TEMP CONT – A and PACK TEMP CONT – B circuit breakers.
Access valve through the appropriate A/C equipment bay access door. The valve is on the right side of the related ACM in the turbine bypass line.
Remove the connector from the turbine bypass valve (TBV).
Loosen the strain relief clamp supporting the connector’s wire bundle.
Remove wire from pin 5 of the TBV connector.
Remove wire from pin 7 of the TBV connector.
Sleeve pin 5 and pin 7 wires individually per Boeing Standard Wiring Practice Manual 20-10-15 using sleeve material RT-876. Sleeve must extend a minimum of one half inch beyond end of pin.
Stow wires to bundle per Boeing Standard Wiring Practices Manual 20-10-11.
Tighten the strain relief clamp supporting the connector’s wire bundle.
Install Allen wrench in manual position shaft and rotate wrench to drive valve to open position as indicated on valve’s position indicator.
Reconnect electrical connector to TBV.
Close the P6 panel PACK TEMP CONT – A and PACK TEMP CONT – B circuit breakers.
